    for (int i=0;i<mishnayot.size();i++) {
        String currentOt=mishnayot.get(i).getOt();
        Button button = new Button(getBaseContext());
        button.setText(currentOt);
        if (_resultId==null)
            throw new IllegalAccessError("missing result id link cannot be created");
        final int index = i;
        button.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View arg0) {
                new Handler().post(new Runnable() {
                    @Override
                    public void run() {
                        View currentView=findViewById(_resultId.get(index));
                        ScrollView scrollView=(ScrollView) findViewById(R.id.resultScroll);
                        scrollView.scrollTo(0, currentView.getTop());
                    }
                });
            }
        });
        navigationLayout.addView(button);
    }
    navigationLayout.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your original code is that the _counter variable is shared among all the buttons. When a button is clicked, it uses the current value of _counter, which is the last value set in the loop. To fix this, we create a final variable index inside the loop that captures the current value of i. This value is then used in the onClick method to get the correct id from the _resultId list. The List.get API is used to retrieve the id from the _resultId list.
